Package com.orchestranetworks.ui

Provides the capability to create custom user interface components that are integrated within EBX5.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ResourceType Identifies an HTTP resource type that can be used for user interface display.
UIAjaxContext Encapsulates an HTTP response so that an Ajax component is able to generate its part of the DHTML page.
UIBodyWriter This interface provides methods for adding text to the body of a document.
UIComponentWriter This interface offers common user interface methods to create standard EBX5 components.
UIContext Common abstract class for UIBeanEditor contexts.
UIJavaScriptWriter This interface provides methods to add some JavaScript in the current response context.
UILabelRenderer Interface for displaying a record in a table or a foreign key constraint.
UILabelRendererContext Provides a context for displaying a record.
UILabelRendererForHierarchy Interface for presenting a hierarchy node inside a hierarchy tree.
UILabelRendererForHierarchyContext Provides a context for displaying a hierarchy node.
UIRenderer Provides a common interface for computing labels.
UIRequestContext Encapsulates an HTTP request so that a bean editor can provide the user input validation context.
UIResourceLocator This interface defines methods to build URLs that change the entity in the current navigation context and access various types of resources (web component, Ajax component, static web resources).
UIResponseContext Encapsulates a HTTP response so that a bean editor is able to generate its part of the DHTML page, including the building of standard EBX5 components.
UIServiceComponentWriter In the context of UI services, this interface allows building standard EBX5 components.
UISessionContext This interface provides methods for retrieving a user session from a user interface component.
UITableFilterContext Common interface for contexts used by a UITableFilter A UITableFilter request context and response context are both associated with a specific data model node and a session.
UITableFilterRequestContext Encapsulates an HTTP request in order to set up a filter.
UITableFilterResponseContext Encapsulates an HTTP request in order to display a table filter.
 

Class Summary
UIAjaxComponent Abstract class for implementing an Ajax component.
UIBeanEditor Abstract class for customizing UI beans on master data.
UIBeanEditorV4 Deprecated. To use only for backward compatibility of UIBeanEditor implementations written in EBX5 release 4.x.
UIButtonIcon This class is used to set the icon of a button.
UIButtonLayout This class can be used to set the layout of a button.
UIButtonRelief This class offers different ways to display the relief of a button.
UIButtonSpec This abstract class provides the common features of different kinds of buttons.
UIButtonSpecJSAction Standard button to launch a JavaScript command.
UIButtonSpecJSActionToggle Standard toggle button that calls a JavaScript command for each change of state.
UIButtonSpecSubmit In the context of UI services, specifies an HTML submit button.
UICSSClasses This class defines all CSS classes usable either for a UI service, for a UI bean or a FormPane.
UICSSClasses.ICONS Here are all CSS classes used to display official icons.
UICSSClasses.TABLE Concerns basic tables (simply <table>, <tr>, <th> and <td> with data in).
UICSSClasses.TEXT Here are all CSS classes used to display official text styles.
UICSSUtils This class defines server-side CSS utilities.
UIFormLabelSpec Specifies a label to display and optional additional documentation accessible in a pop-up.
UIFormLabelSpec.DocumentationPane Describes the content of a documentation pane.
UIFormRowIcon This class can be used to set a built-in icon in front of a form row.
UIFormSpec In the context of UI services, specifies the general features of an HTML form.
UIHttpManagerComponent This class is a utility for invoking user interface components using the HTTP protocol.
UIHttpManagerComponent.CloseButtonSpec Defines the appearance of the close button.
UIHttpManagerComponent.RecordFeatures Constants for features available in record form.
UIHttpManagerComponent.Scope Defines the scope of the user navigation, namely, the parts of the user interface that are available to the user during the session.
UIHttpManagerComponent.ViewFeatures Constants for features available in tables and hierarchies.
UIHttpManagerComponentHelper  
UIHttpManagerComponentReturnCode Represents the return code of a user interaction initiated by UIHttpManagerComponent.
UIRenderingMode Defines the rendering mode of the UI.
UITableCellStyleHandler This class is used to define table cell style for a bean editor.
UITableCellStyleHandler.BackgroundRepeat  
UITableFilter Abstract class for implementing a user interface filter over a table.
 

Exception Summary
ModuleNotFoundException  
 

Package com.orchestranetworks.ui Description

Provides the capability to create custom user interface components that are integrated within EBX5.

Developer Guide

XHTML

The DOCTYPE for EBX5 is set to XHTML 1.0 Transitional. This means that the structure of the HTML is strict and all tags must be closed, even "br" tags. This structure allows for greater control over CSS rules, with smaller differences in rendering between browsers.

Examples

Bad <br>
Good <br/>

Bad<div> <p> Some text here, for example... </p>
Note: in this case, the lack of closing tag "div" will cause instability to the rest of the page below.
Good<div> <p> Some text here, for example... </p></div>

Dynamic loading of JavaScript

Due to the increasing amount of JavaScript in EBX5, an arrangement among the different JavaScripts was needed. A loading system introduces a scheduler for each JavaScript task. Thus, the script inside the page is not executed instantly, but only when the page is fully loaded and fully ready to be modified (i.e. when the DOM is ready). This is very useful because it guarantees that all the elements required for a treatment will be ready.

For example, if an UI bean uses an external API (for example, Google) which requires to be loaded before the DOM is ready, it can not work. Such API provides an other way to be loaded, i.e. dynamically.

Therefore, in a UI bean, JavaScript must be added using UIResponseContext.addJS().

Standard field width

All inputs contained in forms now have a standard width. This width used to be written in the "style" attribute, but is now defined in CSS files. It is applied for selects, and inputs having the types "text", "password" and "file".

Before<input type="text" name="myFieldName" style="width: 300px;"/>
Now<input type="text" name="myFieldName"/>
To define a custom width for an input tag, you can use the "style" attribute:
<input type="text" name="myFieldName" style="width: 50px;"/>

Character-based width

Prior to EBX5, input tags could use the attribute "size" to define a width based on the number of characters. But the size attribute is a visual design attribute, and it is recommended to use CSS instead. Hence, this use is discouraged, and will not work in EBX5.

In order to get a character-based width for an input in your UI beans, you can use the method in the class specially designed for this case UICSSUtils.getFieldWidth(int).

Examples

Bad<input type="text" name="myFieldName" size="4"/>
GoodaResponse.add("<input type=\"text\" name=\"myFieldName\" style=\"" + UICSSUtils.getFieldWidth(4) + "\"/>");

Building and aligning forms

The styling of forms uses the CSS property vertical-align: baseline, where the baseline is the line upon which most characters "sit".

Adding form rows

When adding form rows using UIResponseContext.startFormRow, surround the set of rows with the methods startTableFormRow and endTableFormRow in order maximize conformance with EBX5 user interface standards.

Since a pair of startTableFormRow and endTableFormRow calls can only contain rows added using startFormRow, it will not be possible to surround each row with Div elements. To show and hide entries in a form, use the method UIFormRow.setRowId to assign an HTML identifier to the form row.

To create a form row in a UI bean that is based on the path of a node, use UIResponseContext.newFormRow(Path).

Aligning block elements

For a block element, apply the CSS display style display: inline-table; to align its first element with the baseline. If that style does not result in the desired layout, vertical-align: text-top; can also be used.

General recommendations

In general, minimize the inclusion of specific HTML styles and tags to allow the default styles of EBX5 to apply to custom interfaces. The approach of the API is to automatically apply a standardized style to all elements on HTML pages, while simplifying the implementation process for the developer.
